TF058084-EMERGENCY POWER SECTOR REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Power Sector
            Reform Capacity Reinforcement Project for Lebanon were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was substantial; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            Bank's entering strategy into sensitive political
            topics in complex environments should be carefully
            scrutinized. Being transparent and earning buy-in from
            stakeholders on the reform process is essential: if the
            final industrial structure is not defined ex ante, the
            restructuring assessment should be inclusive of all
            stakeholders to succeed. If one aims at important power
            sector reforms, having a clear and explicit understanding of
            the political economy challenges is essential to understand
            who the winners and losers behind the reform are.
